entry.text: There has been much recent discussion on what .... can and should look like in the future.
entry.example: There has been much recent discussion on what distribution systems can and should look like in the future.

entry.text: Terms related to this discussion include ...., and others.
entry.example: Terms related to this discussion include Smart Grid, Distribution System of the Future, and others.

entry.text: An .... has been developed for ...., and other special applications.
entry.example: An open-source distribution system simulator has been developed for distributed resource planning, harmonic studies, neural-earth voltage studies, volt-var control studies, and other special applications.

entry.text: .... brings about a need to manage .... in a way that is more active.
entry.example: Connection of Distributed Generation brings about a need to manage operation of distribution networks in a way that is more active.

entry.text: Many researches have demonstrated that the .... can have a significant, quantitative effect on its performance characteristics.
entry.example: Many researches have demonstrated that the organizational design employed by an agent system can have a significant, quantitative effect on its performance characteristics.

entry.text: .... is defined as altering the .... of .... by changing .....
entry.example: Feeder reconfiguration is defined as altering the topological structures of distribution feeders by changing the open/closed states of the sectionalizing and tie switches.

entry.text: Motivated by the ... theoretic distinction between ...., we distinguish between .... types of ....: .....
entry.example: Motivated by the control theoretic distinction between controllable and uncontrollable events, we distinguish between two types of agents within a multi-agent system: controllable agents, and uncontrollable agents.

entry.text: .... computing represents an exciting new synthesis .... for .....
entry.example: Agent-based computing represents an exciting new synthesis both for artificial intelligence and, more generally, computer science.

entry.text: It has the potential to significantly improve the .....
entry.example: It has the potential to significantly improve the theory and the practice of modeling, designing, and implementing computer systems.

entry.text: A range of .... have emerged from this line of research, each with different strengths and weakness.
entry.example: A range of organizational strategies have emerged from this line of research, each with different strengths and weakness.

entry.text: Functionally, a .... should be able to provide new abilities such as .....
entry.example: Functionally, a Smart Grid should be able to provide new abilities such as self-healing, high reliability, energy management, and real-time pricing.

entry.text: From a .... perspective, a .... will likely incorporate new technologies such as a.....
entry.example: From a design perspective, a Smart Grid will likely incorporate new technologies such as advanced metering, automation, communication, distributed generation, and distributed storage.

entry.text: In order to allow for this change, .... need to .... of how to manage .....
entry.example: In order to allow for this change, DNOs need to devise strategies of how to manage generator outputs so to facilitate connection of renewable resources and maximize use of network assets.

entry.text: In order to support the .... in terms of effective implementation of ...., .... keys technical issues need to be addressed: ....?
entry.example: In order to support the power engineering community in terms of effective implementation of multi-agent system technology, two keys technical issues need to be addressed: how should/can agents, autonomous intelligent agents and societies of agents be built for power engineering applications?

entry.text: Yet, to date, there has been little systematic analysis of what makes the .... approach such an appealing and powerful .....
entry.example: Yet, to date, there has been little systematic analysis of what makes the agent-based approach such an appealing and powerful computational model.

entry.text: Moreover, even less effort has been devoted to discussing the inherent disadvantages that stem from adopting as .... view.
entry.example: Moreover, even less effort has been devoted to discussing the inherent disadvantages that stem from adopting as agent-oriented view.

entry.text: This paper discussed the potential impact that issues related to .... will have on .....
entry.example: This paper discussed the potential impact that issues related to Smart Grid will have on distribution system design.

entry.text: .... methods are described, in the effort to foster more collaborative research.
entry.example: The software architecture and solution methods are described, in the effort to foster more collaborative research.

entry.text: We give a .... to .... in a .....
entry.example: We give a distributed algorithm to compute shortest paths in a network with changing topology.

entry.text: In this paper the authors discuss the .... available to those wishing to implement .... to .....
entry.example: In this paper the authors discuss the technical aspects of standards, tools, supporting technologies and design methodologies available to those wishing to implement a MAS solution to power engineering problem.

entry.text: In this article we present a survey of the .... used in .....
entry.example: In this article we present a survey of the major organizational paradigms used in multi-agent systems.

entry.text: In this paper, a .... is presented which utilizes .... as a .... in order to .....
entry.example: In this paper, a scheme is presented which utilizes feeder reconfiguration as a planning and/or real-time control tool in order to restructure the primary feeders for loss reduction.

entry.text: This paper surveys recent research on .... for .....
entry.example: This paper surveys recent research on programming languages and development tools for multi-agent systems.

entry.text: Its .... complexities are evaluated.
entry.example: Its time and message complexities are evaluated.

entry.text: Based on the authors' experience of implementing .... for ...., both the benefits and shortcomings of these technologies and approaches are discussed.
entry.example: Based on the authors' experience of implementing multi-agent systems for condition monitoring and the analysis of power system disturbances, both the benefits and shortcomings of these technologies and approaches are discussed.

entry.text: We will provide a description of ...., discuss their advantages and disadvantages, and provide examples of how they may be .....
entry.example: We will provide a description of each, discuss their advantages and disadvantages, and provide examples of how they may be instantiated and maintained.

entry.text: The .... foundation of the .... is given; the solution procedure is illustrated on .... examples.
entry.example: The mathematical foundation of the scheme is given; the solution procedure is illustrated on simple examples.

entry.text: It starts by addressing ...., followed by ...., and finally .....
entry.example: It starts by addressing programming languages (delcarative, imperative, and hybrid), followed by integrated development environments, and finally platforms and frameworks.

entry.text: Using a .... framework, this paper studies the .... in two context: in one context, ...., while in the order .....
entry.example: Using a game-theoretic framework, this paper studies the design of partially controlled multi-agent systems in two context: in one context, the uncontrollable agents are expected utility maximizers, while in the order they are reinforcement learners.

entry.text: This summary will facilitate the comparative evaluation of ...., allowing .... to first recognize the spectrum of possibilities, and then guiding the selection of an appropriate .... for a particular domain and enviroment.
entry.example: This summary will facilitate the comparative evaluation of organizational styles, allowing designers to first recognize the spectrum of possibilities, and then guiding the selection of an appropriate organizational design for a particular domain and enviroment.

entry.text: The current state of these .... is described and, in some cases, indications of future directions of research are given.
entry.example: The current state of these systems is described and, in some cases, indications of future directions of research are given.

entry.text: We suggest different techniques for ...., asses their success, and examine their relationship.
entry.example: We suggest different techniques for controlling agents' behavior in each domain, asses their success, and examine their relationship.

entry.text: This work was supported by ..... This support is greatfully acknowledged.
entry.example: This work was supported by the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NRERC) under grants 227837-04 and 39682-05. This support is greatfully acknowledged.

entry.text: The authors acknowledges to .... for financial support.
entry.example: The authors acknowledges to CERN for financial support to this research.

entry.text: The author acknowledges the invaluable insights provided by ...., and also the help of the anonymous referees who gave comments on earlier versions of this work.
entry.example: The author acknowledges the invaluable insights provided by the late Francis Edward Lewis, and also the help of the anonymous referees who gave comments on earlier versions of this work.

entry.text: The helpful comments and suggestions by .... are gratefully acknowledged.
entry.example: The helpful comments and suggestions by the anonymous reviewers are gratefully acknowledged.
